page.title: 07JUBILEE CELEBRATIONS.
page.content: Tuesday June 7th 1977. In the morning at 10.30 am there was judging of the best display of a{house or garden}.After dinner{ at 2.00 pm there was a{fancy {dress parade}from the Bell to the river.When that had been finished, which was about 2.30 pm, a game of {tug of war}took place over the river. Then at 3.30 pm there were field activities in 'Painters' and a{jubilee {hat competition}for the over 60's. After tea everybody came out at 6.00 pm to the launching of a{hot air {balloon.}Then after that there was children's dancing and at 7.00 pm a comic football match, men v women. When evening came, about 7.30pm a bonfire, disco dancing, singing, skittles, barbeque,and a bar ended the day which celebrated twenty five years of Queen Elizabeth's rule.
